author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Nashik police have launched a manhunt for 12 inmates of the State juvenile correctional facility in Nashik who allegedly fled in the early hours of Monday. The Prisons Department has initiated internal inquiry into the matter.

Confirming the incident, Additional Director General (prisons) Bhushan Kumar Upadhyay said: “We are still finding out how they managed to come out of the remand home in such a big group and escape. The local police have been informed and they are conducting inquiries.”

Officials at the remand home said three of the boys were found guilty in murder cases. All the boys are in the age group of 16 to 19 years and most of them have been convicted for offences such as theft, robbery or burglary.

Of the 12 boys who fled, nine were sentenced by a Pune court, two by a Satara court and one by a court in Mumbai, officials said.
title: 12 juveniles flee Nashik remand home; search on
